i am currently playing a little with Zest to evaluate whether i can use
it for visualizing some of my work. Playing with the test plugin and the
static graph viewer, i always get the stack overflows (trace below) when
moving a node with the left mouse button and then clicking the right
mouse button somewhere else (it doesn't happen always though). I just
wanted to check whether this is something you know about before i create
a bugzilla report (at least i didn't seem to find this one). Is there
any particular "more stable" tagged version that is better for usage or
is CVS head fine?

Ok, I have a reproducable test case. This should not be too hard to fix.

It seems to happen if you have a cycle in your graph.

We unhighlight neighbours before ourselves.  This results in infinite recursion!  I have reversed this order.  Let me know if you have more problems

Thanks for pointing this out.
Yes, i can confirm that it seems to work now (at least for my simple example graph)! Thanks!
